title: The Easiest Most Abundant Edible Plants to Grow in a Garden - Gardening in a Cold Climate

tasks.task: Planting and Growing Potato, Pumpkin, and Summer Squash in a Colder Climate
subtasks: Choose potato varieties suitable for colder climates
Store potatoes in a pantry cool area for long-term storage
Plant pumpkins and summer squashes in a well-drained garden bed
Harvest zucchinis when mature for abundant produce

tasks.task: Growing Beans, Carrots, Beets, and Root Vegetables for Storage
subtasks: Select easy-to-grow bean varieties (e.g., pole and bush beans)
Dig storage trenches or use sand boxes for carrot and beet preservation
Plant winter-hardy radishes and turnips for quick harvests

tasks.task: Cultivating Onions, Garlic, and Herbs for Flavorful Preservation
subtasks: Plant onion sets or bulbs early in the season
Propagate garlic scapes for culinary use in soups and sauces
Create herb garden beds with heat-loving herbs like basil

tasks.task: Raising Fruit Trees and Berries for Long-term Harvest
subtasks: Choose cold-hardy apple, pear, and plum tree varieties
Prune fruit trees annually to promote healthy growth and abundant fruiting
Plant self-seeding amaranth and leafy greens for secondary harvests

tasks.task: Making Sauerkraut and Other Fermented Crops
subtasks: Preserve cabbage through fermentation with salt and herbs
Collect and ferment berries for jams and chutney
Plant rhubarb clumps for long-term yields
Introduce fast-spreading sunchokes (Jerusalem artichokes) for food security
